commentary: Shakib Al Hasan to du Plessis, no run short ball down the leg side, tries to clip it square, misses, it's called a wide, Mushfiqur has appealed for a stumping as du Plessis did leave the crease for just a moment. The appeal for the stumping has been turned on but the review is for a caught-behind. Replays show there is definitely a deflection, but we can't really make out for sure if that was off the thigh pad or the bat. There is no Hot Spot. It's really difficult to make out. It's definitely not a wide, that's for sure. But even close-up replays are inconclusive. The benefit of the doubt goes to the batsman in the end. The wide has been reversed. Worth a review, definitely, but lack of technology the problem this time.

commentary: Peterson to Naeem Islam, OUT Castled! The implosion is complete. A sorry end to their campaign . It was the quicker one that skidded on towards the middle, the batsman went for the cut shot but missed. They collapsed against West Indies, came back to pull off a thriller against England but have surrendered very meekly here. That's that. This is their lowest score against South Africa. Who will be the fall guy for this campaign? Jamie Siddons? Shakib's captaincy? The corridors of power are going to be abuzz in the days to come.
